text: Millie Elizabeth Hughes-Fulford (December 21, 1945 â€“ February 2, 2021) was an American medical investigator, molecular biologist, and NASA payload specialist. She flew aboard the NASA Space Shuttle Columbia in 1991. She was the first female payload specialist in space. Hughes-Fulford was born in Mineral Wells, Texas. Hughes-Fulford died on February 2, 2021 in San Francisco, California from lymphoma at the age of 75. ==References== Category:1945 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Deaths from lymphoma Category:American astronauts Category:American biologists Category:Scientists from Texas
title: Millie Hughes-Fulford
